parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Old, ancient, not new or recent. From palai; antique, i.e. Not recent, worn out.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To crucify together with. From sun and stauroo; to impale in company with.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
No longer, no more. From me and eti; no further.
To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.
